class fatDAE.dolfin_interface.class_control.Bernstein(t_list, t_vrbl)[source]¶

Bases: fatDAE.dolfin_interface.class_control.Control

Time dependent control using Bernstein interpolation.

Parameters

  • t_list (list) –

  • t_vrbl (list) –

t_list¶
Type

list

u_list¶
Type

list

u¶
Type

ufl.algebra.Sum

build_ctrl()[source]¶

Interpolates the control using Bernstein basis functions.

\[\begin{equation} u(t) = \sum_{i=0}^{n} u_i b_i(t) \end{equation}\]

were we have introduced

\[\begin{equation} b_i(t) = {{i}\choose{n}} t^i (1 - t) ^ {(n - i)},\quad i=1,\dots, n \end{equation}\]

known as Bernstein polynomials.

Warning

This interpolation only works if the control is defined within the unit interval…

build_chi()[source]¶

Build the characteristic functions.

They take the form:

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \chi_i(t) = \{ \begin{array}{cll} 1 & if & t_i < t \leq t_{i+1}\\ 0 & otherwise & \end{array} \end{equation}\end{split}\]

for \(i=1,\dots, n-1\) and

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \chi_0(t) = \{ \begin{array}{cll} 1 & if & t_0 \leq t \leq t_{1}\\ 0 & otherwise & \end{array} \end{equation}\end{split}\]

and store them in chi_list.

build_ctrl()[source]¶

Interpolates the control using Lagrange basis functions.

\[\begin{equation} u(t) = \sum_{i=1}^{n}u_i\varphi_i(t) \end{equation}\]
build_phi()[source]¶

Build the basis functions.

class fatDAE.dolfin_interface.class_problem.UFL_Problem(v_form, x_0, t_0, t_f)[source]¶

Bases: fatDAE.class_problem.Problem

Initial value problem.

It takes a variational formulation, for example: Find \(u \in L^2((t_0,t_f];H_0^1(\Omega))\) such that

\[\begin{equation} \int_\Omega p(u)\frac{\partial u}{\partial t}v\;d\Omega - \int_{\Omega}q(u)\nabla u \cdot \nabla v\;d\Omega - \int_{\Omega}fv\;d\Omega = 0,\quad \forall v\in H_{0}^{1}(\Omega) \end{equation}\]

(were the time derivative must be declared as a trial function) in order to extract:

  • a bilinear form M_form, defined as

\[\begin{equation} M(\frac{\partial u}{\partial t}, v; u) = \int_\Omega p(u)\frac{\partial u}{\partial t}v\;d\Omega \end{equation}\]

  • a bilinear form f_form, defined as

\[\begin{equation} \hspace{4cm} f(v; u) = \int_{\Omega}q(u)\nabla u \cdot \nabla v\;d\Omega + \int_{\Omega}fv\;d\Omega \end{equation}\]

Args:

M_form¶

2-form associated to the time derivative.

Type

ufl.form.Form

f_form¶

1-form associated to the right hand side.

Type

ufl.form.Form

I_interior¶

Diagonal matrix with 1’s in the diagonal for interior nodes and 0’s otherwise, created by set_boundary().

Type

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix

I_boundary¶

Diagonal matrix with 0’s in the diagonal for interior nodes and 1’s otherwise, created by set_boundary().

Type

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix

boundary_conditions¶

List of dolfin.fem.bcs.DirichletBC items, created by set_boundary().

Type

list

boundary_dervatives¶

List of dolfin.fem.bcs.DirichletBC items, created by set_boundary().

Type

list

dfdx_form¶

2-form arising from the differentiation of f_form.

dfdt_form¶

1-form arising from the differentiation of f_form.

Warning

The time in the variational formulation…
